alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 28 at 5:03PM MST until July 28 at 5:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR COCONINO AND YAVAPAI COUNTIES... At 459 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms have weakened across the area extending from Camp Verde, Cottonwood and Sedona with only light to moderate immbedded showers. Low water crossings are likely still flowing along with ponding on few area roadways. Drive with caution. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Camp Verde, Sedona, Village At Oak Creek, Rimrock, Montezuma Well, Lake Montezuma, Mcguireville, Montezuma Castle National Monument, Page Springs, Cornville, Middle Verde, Stoneman Lake, Cottonwood, Wet Beaver Creek Campground, V Bar V Visitors Center and Red Rock State Park. This includes the following highways... State Route 260 between mile markers 214 and 223. Interstate 17 between mile markers 287 and 318. State Route 179 between mile markers 299 and 313. State Route 89A between mile markers 367 and 378. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Verde River, Walker Creek, Oak Creek, Gaddis Wash, Dry Beaver Creek, West Clear Creek, Jacks Canyon, Dry Creek, Brady Canyon, Rarick Canyon, Turkey Creek, Rattlesnake Canyon, Beaver Creek, Long Canyon, Spring Creek, Russell Wash, Grief Hill Wash and Cherry Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
